intro: Eriocoma ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaved eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in yellow or white hues. Eriocoma ovalifolia is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
